recount3 0.99.0

Internal function for creating a recount3 RangedSummarizedExperiment object

Source: R/create_rse_manual.R
create_rse_manual.Rd

This function is used internally by create_rse() to construct a recount3 RangedSummarizedExperiment-class object that contains the base-pair coverage counts at the gene or exon feature level for a given annotation.

create_rse_manual(
  project,
  project_home = project_home_available(organism = organism, recount3_url =
    recount3_url, bfc = bfc),
  type = c("gene", "exon", "jxn"),
  organism = c("human", "mouse"),
  annotation = annotation_options(organism),
  bfc = BiocFileCache::BiocFileCache(),
  jxn_format = c("ALL", "UNIQUE"),
  recount3_url = "http://idies.jhu.edu/recount3/data"
)

Arguments

project

A character(1) with the ID for a given study.
project_home

A character(1) with the home directory for the project. You can find these using project_home_available().
type

A character(1) specifying whether you want to access gene, exon, or exon-exon junction counts.
organism

A character(1) specifying which organism you want to download data from. Supported options are "human" or "mouse".
annotation

A character(1) specifying which annotation you want to download. Only used when type is either gene or exon.
bfc

A BiocFileCache-class object where the files will be cached to.
jxn_format

A character(1) specifying whether the exon-exon junction files are derived from all the reads (ALL) or only the uniquely mapping read counts (UNIQUE). Note that UNIQUE is only available for some projects.
recount3_url

A character(1) specifying the home URL for recount3 or a local directory where you have mirrored recount3.

Value

A RangedSummarizedExperiment-class object.

References

https://doi.org/10.12688/f1000research.12223.1 for details on the base-pair coverage counts used in recount2 and recount3.

See also

Other internal functions for accessing the recount3 data: annotation_ext(), file_locate_url_annotation(), file_locate_url(), file_retrieve(), project_home_available(), read_counts(), read_metadata()

Examples


## Unlike create_rse(), here we create an RSE object by
## fully specifying all the arguments for locating this study
rse_gene_SRP009615_manual <- create_rse_manual(
    "SRP009615",
    "data_sources/sra"
)

#> 2020-09-28 03:11:08 downloading and reading the metadata.
#> 2020-09-28 03:11:08 caching file sra.sra.SRP009615.MD.gz.
#> 2020-09-28 03:11:08 caching file sra.recount_project.SRP009615.MD.gz.
#> 2020-09-28 03:11:08 caching file sra.recount_qc.SRP009615.MD.gz.
#> 2020-09-28 03:11:10 caching file sra.recount_seq_qc.SRP009615.MD.gz.
#> 2020-09-28 03:11:10 caching file sra.recount_pred.SRP009615.MD.gz.
#> Warning: Replacing study_acc by study in sra.sra.SRP009615.MD.gz
#> Warning: Replacing run_acc by external_id in sra.sra.SRP009615.MD.gz
#> Warning: Replacing study_acc by study in sra.recount_qc.SRP009615.MD.gz
#> Warning: Replacing run_acc by external_id in sra.recount_qc.SRP009615.MD.gz
#> 2020-09-28 03:11:10 downloading and reading the feature information.
#> 2020-09-28 03:11:11 caching file human.gene_sums.G026.gtf.gz.
#> 2020-09-28 03:11:11 downloading and reading the counts: 12 samples across 63856 features.
#> 2020-09-28 03:11:11 caching file sra.gene_sums.SRP009615.G026.gz.
#> 2020-09-28 03:11:12 construcing the RangedSummarizedExperiment (rse) object.
rse_gene_SRP009615_manual

#> class: RangedSummarizedExperiment 
#> dim: 63856 12 
#> metadata(8): time_created recount3_version ... annotation recount3_url
#> assays(1): raw_counts
#> rownames(63856): ENSG00000278704.1 ENSG00000277400.1 ...
#>   ENSG00000182484.15_PAR_Y ENSG00000227159.8_PAR_Y
#> rowData names(10): source type ... havana_gene tag
#> colnames(12): SRR387777 SRR387778 ... SRR389077 SRR389078
#> colData names(173): rail_id external_id ... recount_pred.pred.type
#>   BigWigURL

## Check how much memory this RSE object uses
pryr::object_size(rse_gene_SRP009615_manual)

#> 21.7 MB

## Test with a collection that has a single sample
## NOTE: this requires loading the full data for this study when
## creating the RSE object
rse_gene_ERP110066_collection_manual <- create_rse_manual(
    "ERP110066",
    "collections/geuvadis_smartseq",
    recount3_url = "http://snaptron.cs.jhu.edu/data/temp/recount3"
)

#> adding rname 'http://snaptron.cs.jhu.edu/data/temp/recount3/human/data_sources'

## Mouse example
rse_gene_DRP002367_manual <- create_rse_manual(
    "DRP002367",
    "data_sources/sra",
    organism = "mouse"
)

#> 2020-09-28 03:11:21 downloading and reading the metadata.
#> 2020-09-28 03:11:21 caching file sra.sra.DRP002367.MD.gz.

## Test with a collection that has one sample, at the exon level
## NOTE: this requires loading the full data for this study (nearly 6GB!)
if (FALSE) {
rse_exon_ERP110066_collection_manual <- create_rse_manual(
    "ERP110066",
    "collections/geuvadis_smartseq",
    type = "exon",
    recount3_url = "http://snaptron.cs.jhu.edu/data/temp/recount3"
)
rse_exon_ERP110066_collection_manual


## Check how much memory this RSE object uses
pryr::object_size(rse_exon_ERP110066_collection_manual)
# 409 MB

## Test with a collection that has one sample, at the junction level
## NOTE: this requires loading the full data for this study
system.time(rse_jxn_ERP110066_collection_manual <- create_rse_manual(
    "ERP110066",
    "collections/geuvadis_smartseq",
    type = "jxn",
    recount3_url = "http://snaptron.cs.jhu.edu/data/temp/recount3"
))
rse_jxn_ERP110066_collection_manual

## Check how much memory this RSE object uses
## NOTE: this doesn't run since 2 files are missing on the test site!
pryr::object_size(rse_jxn_ERP110066_collection_manual)
}

if (FALSE) {
## For testing and debugging
project <- "ERP110066"
project_home <- "collections/geuvadis_smartseq"

project <- "SRP009615"
project_home <- "data_sources/sra"
type <- "gene"
organism <- "human"
annotation <- "refseq"
jxn_format <- "ALL"
bfc <- BiocFileCache::BiocFileCache()
recount3_url <- "http://idies.jhu.edu/recount3/data"
}
